description:
Rear Garden
T1 - Sycamore
Fell to ground level and treat stump. Grind all roots in the flat part of the garden causing trip hazards.

â?¢	T1 sycamore is located in the rear garden along the rear boundary.
â?¢	The tree is the cause of an unreasonable amount of shade to the rear aspect of the property.
â?¢	The tree is of little amenity value and is in decline.

Please Note:
T1 is a Sycamore of poor shape and form, the roots are spreading towards the property and causing various health and safety trip hazard issues. These roots have the potential to cause structural damage to the property.

â?¢	T1 sycamore is located in the rear garden along the rear boundary.
â?¢	The tree is the cause of an unreasonable amount of shade to the rear aspect of the property.
â?¢	The tree is of little amenity value and is in decline.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: Works would be detrimental to the visual amenity of the local area.
The justification/evidence submitted is not sufficient to warrant the work applied for.

Without sufficient justification and evidence proving why the tree is unsafe and why lesser courses of action cannot be followed, any future applications requesting to fell without this information will be refused.
